nytimes.title: History of Lynchings in the South Documents Nearly 4,000 Names
nytimes.topComment: Germany has acknowledged its holocaust. We can visit memorials there. Lest we forget what human beings are capable of, we need markers, museums, and history kept alive. We have a terrible side to our own history. To refuse to acknowledge it perpetuat...

nytimes.title: Well: Was Brian Williams a Victim of False Memory?
nytimes.topComment:
